0.Title: The Coveted Starting Player
0.Description: Other players may transfer this card to their playing area for 1 of any of the following: Stone, Clay, Silk, Boar, Glass, Gold, Cattle, Vegetable, Food.
0.Snark: Because just going around in a circle is not strategic enough.

1.Title: The Building Building Building
1.Description: You may now build buildings. You may only take one of these into your hand per game.
1.Snark: Really, it's just a coincidence that we happen to also be housed in a building. In fact, we built our own building. We did not need a building building building building building.

5.Title: The Military Strategy
5.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In the case of a tie, nobody gets the bonus. You may only own 1 Military Engine.
5.Snark: This strategy worked for me once. I think.

6.Title: The Reaction to Military Strategy
6.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In the case of a tie, nobody gets the bonus. You may only own 1 Military Engine.
6.Snark: If this card is available, somebody better take this.

7.Title: The Reaction to Military Strategy
7.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In the case of a tie, nobody gets the bonus. You may only own 1 Military Engine.
7.Snark: If this card is available, somebody better take this.

8.Title: The Grain Engine
8.Description: You may use 1 Grain for any 1 Resource, or 1 Grain for 2 Food, any number of times.
8.Snark: A solid choice, but be sure to commit to it.

60.Title: The Early Investment
60.Description: You must play this card before playing an Engine.
60.Snark: Does nothing now, but it will pay off later. The engine can wait.

61.Title: More Grain!
61.Description: You may trash this card for 1 Food.
61.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

62.Title: More Veggies!
62.Description: You may trash this card for 2 Food.
62.Snark: What's better than one veggie? Two veggies and a VP.

63.Title: The Wildcard Building
63.Description: You may substitute 1 Silk for any 1 Resource, any number of times.
63.Snark: Be sure to take this from someone who has collected silk.

64.Title: Sheep Breed!
64.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

65.Title: Sheep Breed!
65.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

66.Title: Sheep Breed!
66.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

67.Title: The Stone Building Building
67.Description: You do not need to pay any required Stone for Buildings.
67.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need stone for our building.

68.Title: The Wood Building Building
68.Description: You do not need to pay any required Wood for Buildings
68.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need Wood for our building.

69.Title: The Clay Building Building
69.Description: You do not need to pay any required Clay for Buildings.
69.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need Clay for our building.

70.Title: The Cattle Engine
70.Description: You may use 1 Cattle for 2 Food, or 1 Cattle for any other Resource.
70.Snark: Wish this had come out sooner…

71.Title: The Obligatory 3:1 Trader
71.Description: You may substitute 3 Resources of any type(s) for 1 of any Resource.
71.Snark: I'm sure I'll use this enough to justify its purchase.

72.Title: The Military Building
72.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. Ties don't count. You may only play this if you already have at least 1 Military.
72.Snark: And how do we feel about going military right about now?

73.Title: Even More Grain!
73.Description: You may also use this card for 1 Food
73.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

74.Title: Even More Grain!
74.Description: You may also use this card for 1 Food
74.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

75.Title: The Cheap Building
75.Snark: Hey, VPs are VPs. Every little bit counts.

76.Title: The Premium Building
76.Snark: Seems like a lot now, but we have an epic endgame coming up.

77.Title: The Easy Building
77.Snark: Nice! Way to get some bigger points on the board.

78.Title: The Good Building
78.Snark: Nice! Way to get some points on the board.

79.Title: The Better Building
79.Snark: Don't get all your VPs too early now.

80.Title: The Decent Building
80.Snark: Just when you think you've pulled ahead, someone else will get a bigger building than this.

81.Title: Cattle Breed!
81.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

82.Title: Cattle Breed!
82.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

83.Title: Even More Veggies!
83.Description: You may also use this card for 2 Food
83.Snark: This is a garden, not some sort of weird patch that passively injects beta-Carotene into your skin.

84.Title: Even More Veggies!
84.Description: You may also use this card for 2 Food
84.Snark: This is a garden, not some sort of weird patch that passively injects beta-Carotene into your skin.

85.Title: The Dude
85.Description: When played, place in front of the player to your left. Subsequent players may trash 1 Food to continue passing, or trash 2 food to remove this card from the game.
85.Snark: One move of the dude is a four-point swing. Don't ever forget about him.

86.Title: The Arms Race
86.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. In case of tie, nobody gets the bonus.
86.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

87.Title: The Arms Race
87.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. In case of tie, nobody gets the bonus.
87.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

88.Title: The Arms Race
88.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. In case of tie, nobody gets the bonus.
88.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

89.Title: The Unfair Deck Dive
89.Description: You may retrieve any Resource, Early Game, or Midgame card in the discard pile and play it immediately without prerequisites.
89.Snark: Playing this has the hidden advantage of making your opponents hate you.

90.Title: The Expensive Engine
90.Description: You may use 1 Resource for 1 other Resource, once per turn.
90.Snark: Don't base your entire strategy on this card.

91.Title: The Payoff Payoff
91.Description: 2 VPs for each Payoff you have placed.
91.Snark: The only thing better than VPs are VPs that spawned from the production of other VPs.

93.Title: The Easily-Disrupted Payoff
93.Description: 8 VPs  if you have Starting Player at the end of the game. Once you play this card, you may not steal Starting Player.
93.Snark: I REALLY hope nobody notices that I played this.

94.Title: The Unexpected Payoff
94.Snark: This card favors those who have this deck memorized.

95.Title: The Suboptimal Strategy Payoff
95.Description: 1 VP for each type of Resource at the end of the game.
95.Snark: This is to make you feel better about having unused stuff.

96.Title: The Investment Payoff
96.Snark: See! I told you that card would pay off.

97.Title: The Low-Risk Payoff
97.Description: 1 VP for each Wood, Sheep, or Grain
97.Snark: Hey, at least you know nobody else is going for it.

98.Title: The Payoff With Math
98.Description: At game end, VPs are the number of Glass you have in your hand squared plus the number of Silks you have.
98.Snark: Go ahead and take your next turn, this is gonna take me a moment.

99.Title: The Military Payoff
99.Description: 2 VP for each Military, +2 additional VP if you end the game with the most military (ties don't count).

100.Title: The Building Payoff Building
100.Description: 2 VP for each Building you've played
100.Snark: You had to see this one coming.
